5_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr.body: GNU Icecat. It comes loaded with all kinds of "muh free software" bloatware though. blocking unfree javascript and so on. But once you get rid of that is like firefox without the mozilla-bloat.

Chrome/Chromium, for Desktop.
Becaus it has a nice clean interface and you can easily switch profiles. Also the bookmarkbar that disappears once you load a page is nice. I tried to make Firefox behave and look more like Chrome, but it didnt really work.

Firefox/Icecat for Android.
Because Chrome for Android is just too minimalistic, i want to be able to have extensions and i want to edit my search engine to allways-google-dot-com so i dont get censored search results. Also the reading view in Firefox is nice and i like the firefox interface on android better than the chrome one.

4_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf.body:
> [nippletwister](#comment_13_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): Does anyone know a software to delete spying tools from Windows 7?I did not plan to use Win 10 anyway, but need Win 7 for work.

Best thing you can do is isolate it in a virtual machine and only use it for what you need to use it for.
You can also just use it offline and then access your work results from the host machine in a shared folder.
